description:
This protocol gives a method for prophage induction in marine Synechococcus.

Paul, J. H., and M. Weinbauer. 2010. Detection of lysogeny in marine environments, p. 30–33. In S. W. Wilhelm, M. G. Weinbauer, and C. A. Suttle [eds.], Manual of Aquatic Viral Ecology. ASLO.
before_start: The samples for prophage induction are pretreated by the technique of viral reduction (Weinbauer and Suttle 1996).

collections.protocol_name: Detection of Lysogeny in Marine Environments
collections.protocol_name_html: Detection of Lysogeny in Marine Environments

authors: John H. Paul and Markus Weinbauer

authors_list.name: John H. Paul and Markus Weinbauer

guidelines:
Materials

Sterile 96 well microtiter plates
Indicator host culture (i.e., Synechococcus WH7803)

References

Hurley, M. A., and M. E. Roscoe. 1983. Automated statistical analysis of microbial enumeration by dilution series. J. Appl. Bacteriol. 55:159-164.

Suttle, C. A., and A. M. Chan. 1994. Dynamics and distribution of cyanophages and their effect on marine Synechoccus spp. Appl. Environ. Microbiol. 60:3167-3174.

Weinbauer, M. G., and C. A. Suttle. 1996. Potential significance of lysogeny to bacteriophage production and bacterial mortality in coastal waters of the Gulf of Mexico. Appl. Environ. Microbiol. 62:4374-4380.

components.data: Filter each sample through a 0.2-µm filter to a volume of approximately 5 mL to remove most of the ambient viruses.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Filter each sample through a 0.2-µm filter to a volume of approximately 5 mL to remove most of the ambient viruses.

components.data: Induction
components.name: Section

components.data: Add virus-free (0.02-µm filtered) water prepared from the same sample and reduce the volume a second time.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add virus-free (0.02-µm filtered) water prepared from the same sample and reduce the volume a second time.

components.data: Induction
components.name: Section

components.data: Return the retentate to its original volume by adding virus-free seawater, dividing into aliquots, and incubating with and without inducing agent.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Return the retentate to its original volume by adding virus-free seawater, dividing into aliquots, and incubating with and without inducing agent.

components.data: Induction
components.name: Section

components.data: Amend treated samples with the inducing agent mitomycin C at a concentration of 1 µg/mL or with the inducing agent of choice.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Amend treated samples with the inducing agent mitomycin C at a concentration of 1 µg/mL or with the inducing agent of choice.

components.data: Induction
components.name: Section

components.data: Employ the most probable number (MPN) method to enumerate the cyanophage population (Suttle and Chan 1994).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Employ the most probable number (MPN) method to enumerate the cyanophage population (Suttle and Chan 1994).

components.data: Enumeration
components.name: Section

components.data: Prepare a one- to five-dilution series of the environmental or prophage induction treatment sample using 96-well microtiter plates (Costar, Corning Inc.).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Prepare a one- to five-dilution series of the environmental or prophage induction treatment sample using 96-well microtiter plates (Costar, Corning Inc.).

components.data: Enumeration
components.name: Section

components.data: Freshly dilute a susceptible Synechococcus host 1:10 and place in each well.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Freshly dilute a susceptible Synechococcus host 1:10 and place in each well.

components.data: Enumeration
components.name: Section

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 7 of Prophage induction in marine Synechococcus
source_data.annotation: Either Synechococcus isolate WH7803, our own isolate GM9901, or both.
source_data.thread_text: Either Synechococcus isolate WH7803, our own isolate GM9901, or both.
source_data.body: Either Synechococcus isolate WH7803, our own isolate GM9901, or both.

components.data: Prepare control plates similarly using sterile SN media in the first column of wells.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Prepare control plates similarly using sterile SN media in the first column of wells.

components.data: Enumeration
components.name: Section

components.data: Prepare three replicate treatment and control plates from each site.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Prepare three replicate treatment and control plates from each site.

components.data: Enumeration
components.name: Section

components.data: Incubate the plates until good growth of the host organism is evident (10–14 days).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate the plates until good growth of the host organism is evident (10–14 days).

components.data: Enumeration
components.name: Section

components.data: Score wells as positive for virus if lysis of the host organism is evident as a well clearing.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Score wells as positive for virus if lysis of the host organism is evident as a well clearing.

components.data: Enumeration
components.name: Section

components.data: Calculate viral abundance for each plate using an MPN program (Hurley and Roscoe 1983).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Calculate viral abundance for each plate using an MPN program (Hurley and Roscoe 1983).

components.data: Enumeration
components.name: Section

components.data: Evaluate treatment and control cyanophage and Synechococcus counts by paired t test between samples using Minitab statistical software.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Evaluate treatment and control cyanophage and Synechococcus counts by paired t test between samples using Minitab statistical software.

components.data: Data analysis
components.name: Section

components.data: Perform comparison of induction results and environmental parameters using linear regression and X<sup>2 </sup> analysis, also using Minitab.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Perform comparison of induction results and environmental parameters using linear regression and X<sup>2 </sup> analysis, also using Minitab.

components.data: Data analysis
components.name: Section
